alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 10:10PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Heavy Rainfall Persisting Across Southeast Carroll and Southwest Patrick Counties... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...In Southwest Virginia, Southeast Carroll and Southwest Patrick Counties. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1007 PM EDT, Doppler radar estimates that rainfall of 1.5 to 2.0 inches has fallen during the past hour in the general area of Groundhog Mountain to Cana to Ararat. This rainfall on already saturated ground from previous rainfall events will quickly result in excessive runoff and minor flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hookers Creek, Archies Creek, Fall Creek, Birds Branch, Doe Run Creek, Dan River, Ararat River, Big Reed Island Creek and Brushy Fork. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ararat... Cana... Groundhog Mountain... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
